SEARCH
Package oop2.jeopardy.game

Class Game

java.lang.Object
oop2.jeopardy.game.Game
public class Game extends Object
Represents the main controller for running a multiplayer Jeopardy game. This class manages player setup, the game loop, question flow, score handling, event logging, report generation, and end-of-game statistics.

The Game class acts as the core orchestrator that interacts with GameBoard, TurnManager, QuestionBank, and GameEventLogger to produce a complete game experience.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Kadie Bisnath - 816036090

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(List<Question> questions)
      Creates a new Game instance using a list of questions.
      Parameters:
      questions - a list of pre-loaded questions for the session

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start() throws Exception
      Starts the Jeopardy game. This includes initializing the game board, setting up players, running the main game loop, displaying final scores, and generating an optional report.
      Throws:
      Exception - if a report fails to generate

    • setupPlayers

      private void setupPlayers()
      Prompts the user to input how many players will join, and collects each player's name. Player creation events are logged to the event logger.

    • gameLoop

      private void gameLoop()
      The primary game loop. Each iteration represents one player's turn. The loop runs until all questions are exhausted or a player quits.

    • showBoard

      private void showBoard()
      Displays the current state of the game board and logs the action.

    • askQuestion

      private void askQuestion(Player player, Question q)
      Asks a question to the current player, processes the answer, updates the score, logs the event, and stores the game record.
      Parameters:
      player - the player currently answering
      q - the question being asked

    • generateReport

      private void generateReport()
      Interacts with the user to determine whether a report should be generated. Allows choosing from TXT, PDF, or DOCX output formats and handles filename creation and file output.

    • showFinalScores

      private void showFinalScores()
      Displays the final scoreboard, determines the winner, and prints additional statistics including highest correct answers and highest incorrect answers.

    • readIntInRange

      private int readIntInRange(int low, int high)
      Reads an integer from the user, ensuring it falls within the specified range.
      Parameters:
      low - the minimum accepted value
      high - the maximum accepted value
      Returns:
      a validated integer within the given bounds
